Federal student loan borrowers are automatically being placed in an administrative forbearance, which allows you to temporarily stop making your monthly loan payments. In addition, interest is being temporarily set at 0% on federal student loans.

Your federal loan servicer will let you know what your remaining balance is after the interest waiver has been applied.
